main event: A civilian observer in Pueblo, Colorado sighted an unidentified oval-shaped, black object circling overhead for about 30 minutes on April 15, 1966.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a penny and was seen distinctly overhead.
There was a cloud-like formation behind the object.
The observer and four friends were watching the object through a 40-power telescope.
The observer left to notify the authorities after about 30 minutes of observation.
The Air Force concluded that the object was likely a six-foot diameter atmospheric sounding balloon released from Fort Carson, Colorado earlier that day.
photographs: No photographs included in the report
